Key Match Events: De’Aaron Fox scored 33 points, leading the Sacramento Kings to a 110-100 victory over the Dallas Mavericks.
Doug Christie secured his first win as the interim head coach of the Kings.
The Kings went on a 17-2 run to end the third quarter and took an 83-77 lead.
Sacramento started the fourth quarter on an 11-4 run, extending the lead to double digits on a 3-pointer by Trey Lyles.
Spencer Dinwiddie scored 30 points and PJ Washington had 28 points for the Mavericks, both season highs.
Post-Match Reflections: Doug Christie expressed satisfaction with the win, marking his first victory as interim head coach.
The Kings snapped a six-game losing streak, overcoming an 18-point first-quarter deficit.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Mavericks were without key players including Kyrie Irving, Klay Thompson, Dereck Lively II, Naji Marshall, and Luka Doncic.
The Kings held the Mavericks to 40 second-half points after allowing the Lakers to shoot 60% from the field in their previous game.
